# Arpeggio: Minor 7b5 in C (Shape: E)

## Brief Presentation
The Minor 7b5 arpeggio, also known as half-diminished arpeggio, is a four-note chord found in the harmonic minor scale. In the context of C, the notes in this arpeggio are C (root), Eb (minor third), Gb (diminished fifth), and Bb (minor seventh). This arpeggio creates a unique and somewhat tense sound due to the presence of the diminished fifth interval.

## Notes and Intervals
- C (Root)
- Eb (Minor Third)
- Gb (Diminished Fifth)
- Bb (Minor Seventh)

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Minor 7b5 arpeggio is commonly used in jazz, fusion, and some forms of progressive rock. It adds a mysterious and edgy flavor to the music, often creating tension that can be resolved in interesting ways. The diminished fifth interval provides a dissonant quality that can evoke a sense of intrigue and drama in compositions.
